Class BCryptFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.password4j.AbstractHashingFunction

    public class BCryptFunction
extends AbstractHashingFunction
    Class containing the implementation of BCrypt function and its parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static BCryptFunction getInstance(int logRounds)
        Creates a singleton instance, depending on the provided logarithmic cost.

        The cost is expressed with the following formula: cost = 2^logRounds

        Parameters:
        logRounds - logarithmic cost
        Returns:
        a singleton instance
        Since:
        0.3.0

      • hash

        public Hash hash(CharSequence plainTextPassword)
        Description copied from interface: HashingFunction
        Creates a Hash from a plaintext password. Depending on the implementation, the hash may contain the information about salt and pepper.

        The salt is always generated randomly.

        The generation of the salt is completely responsibility of the implementing class.

        Parameters:
        plainTextPassword - the password to be hashed
        Returns:
        a Hash
        See Also:
        HashingFunction.hash(CharSequence, String)

      • hash

        public Hash hash(CharSequence plainTextPassword,
                 String salt)
        Description copied from interface: HashingFunction
        Creates a Hash from a plaintext password and a salt. Depending on the implementation, the hash may contain the information about salt and pepper.

        Some CHFs validate the format of the salt; if the validation is not passed a BadParametersException is thrown. The generation of the salt is completely responsibility of the caller.

        Parameters:
        plainTextPassword - the password to be hashed
        salt - the salt used in the hashing process
        Returns:
        a Hash

      • check

        public boolean check(CharSequence plainTexPassword,
                     String hashed)
        Description copied from interface: HashingFunction
        Checks if the CHF generated the hash starting from the plaintext password.

        This method must be used when the salt is part of the hash. If the CHF expects a salt separated from the hash, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

        In case the CHF expects a salt to be part of the hash, if the format of the hash is not valid (e.g. the CHF cannot recognise a valid salt) a BadParametersException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        plainTexPassword - the plaintext password
        hashed - the hash
        Returns:
        true if the hash is generated from the plaintext; false otherwise

      • encodeBase64

        protected static void encodeBase64(byte[] toBeEncoded,
                                   int length,
                                   StringBuilder sb)
        Encode a byte array using BCrypt's slightly-modified base64 encoding scheme. Note that this is not compatible with the standard MIME-base64 encoding.
        Parameters:
        toBeEncoded - the byte array to encode
        length - the number of bytes to encode
        sb - StringBuilder representing the base64-encoded string
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length is invalid
        Since:
        0.1.0

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the decoded value of x
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • decodeBase64

        protected static byte[] decodeBase64(String str,
                                     int maxOLength)
        Decode a string encoded using BCrypt's base64 scheme to a byte array. Note that this is *not* compatible with the standard MIME-base64 encoding.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to decode
        maxOLength - the maximum number of bytes to decode
        Returns:
        an array containing the decoded bytes
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxOLength is invalid
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • encipher

        protected void encipher(int[] lr,
                        int off,
                        int[] pArray,
                        int[] sBox)
        Blowfish encipher a single 64-bit block encoded as two 32-bit halves
        Parameters:
        lr - an array containing the two 32-bit half blocks
        off - the position in the array of the blocks
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • streamToWords

        protected static int[] streamToWords(byte[] data,
                                     int[] offPointer,
                                     int[] signp)
        Cyclically extracts a word of key material
        Parameters:
        data - the string to extract the data from
        offPointer - a "pointer" (as a one-entry array) to the current offset into data
        Returns:
        the next word of material from data
        Since:
        0.1.0

                                   boolean signExtBug,

      • cryptRaw

        protected byte[] cryptRaw(byte[] password,
                          byte[] salt,
                          int logRounds,
                          boolean sign,
                          int safety)
        Perform the central password hashing step in the BCrypt scheme
        Parameters:
        password - the password to hash
        salt - the binary salt to hash with the password
        logRounds - the binary logarithm of the number of rounds of hashing to apply
        Returns:
        an array containing the binary hashed password
        Since:
        0.1.0

        protected String hashPw(CharSequence password,
                        String salt)
        Hash a password using the OpenBSD bcrypt scheme
        Parameters:
        password - the password to hash
        salt - the salt to hash with (perhaps generated using generateSalt(int))
        Returns:
        the hashed password
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • generateSalt

        protected static String generateSalt(String prefix,
                                     int logRounds)

      • generateSalt

        protected static String generateSalt(int logRounds)
        Generate a salt to be used with the hash(CharSequence, String) method
        Parameters:
        logRounds - the log2 of the number of rounds of hashing to apply - the work factor therefore increases as 2^log_rounds.
        Returns:
        an encoded salt value
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • checkPw

        protected boolean checkPw(CharSequence plaintext,
                          String hashed)
        Check that a plaintext password matches a previously hashed one
        Parameters:
        plaintext - the plaintext password to verify
        hashed - the previously-hashed password
        Returns:
        true if the passwords match, false otherwise
        Since:
        0.1.0
